newsitem.title: JAPAN: Nippon Steel says no comment on earnings report.
newsitem.headline: Nippon Steel says no comment on earnings report.

text.p: Nippon Steel Corp declined to comment on Friday on a newspaper report that the firm's parent current profit for the six months to September 30, 1996, would be about 25 billion yen, down 15 percent from its actual half-year current profit a year ago.
The business daily Nihon Keizai Shimbun said it expected a fall in Nippon Steel's six-month profit because of delays in inventory adjustment.
The paper said Nippon Steel earlier this year forecast a 1996/97 half-year current profit of 35 billion yen.

But Nippon Steel and other Japanese steelmakers said earlier this week that their half-year parent current profits might be smaller than the forecasts they announced in May, due to delays in inventory adjustment.

Kawasaki Steel Corp said its parent current profit for the first half of 1996/97 would be smaller than its May forecast of 10 billion yen, but did not provide a specific revised figure. Kawasaki posted a parent current profit of 6.20 billion yen in the six months to September 30, 1995.
Spokesmen for several steelmakers said the industry's situation has been more difficult than they formerly thought.
